description: A strange 'revolver' from the 60s that fires triangular 'trounds'. It never really picked up in popularity, and mostly existed as a collector's item. Maybe it should stay that way in this post-cataclysm world, since better options exist even among trounds. At least it carries a lot of shots.

A strange gun from the 60s that fires triangular 'trounds'. It never really picked up in popularity, and mostly existed as a collector's item. Maybe it should stay that way in this post-cataclysm world, since better options exist even among trounds. This one's fully functional, but partially made out of translucent plastic for whatever reason. Maybe the plastic parts were made for use in a show that described weapons that people forgot

A strange gun from the 60s that fires triangular 'trounds'. It never really picked up in popularity, and mostly existed as a collector's item. Maybe it should stay that way in this post-cataclysm world, since better options exist even among trounds. This one's been converted to a carbine for some reason.
A rare gun from the late 60s, and an evolution off the Dardick model 1500, this pistol holds 20 trounds instead. It is not compatable with speedloaders, however.
